intro: Piriqueta corumbensis, commonly known as the Corumbá piriqueta, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wetland areas and is adapted to humid, tropical climates. It has a short stem and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous seeds. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
